intro: Calandrinia pogonophora, commonly known as the woolly purslane, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Mallow, characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in summer, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its succulent leaves and stems help it retain water, making it drought-tolerant.
